title: 50 Things Amy Sedaris Can’t Live Without
text:
Amy Sedaris. Photo: Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images

Amy Sedaris is particular about her stuff. So particular, in fact, that when the Strategist site launched in 2016, her distinct kind of particular-ness when it came to shopping was discussed as one of our many inspirations for what the site could be. So when I visited her stuffed-to-the-brim one bedroom on a recent afternoon, it was not much of a surprise to find a Venn diagram of most every type of thing the Strategist covers: from surprising things that have multiple uses (the drugstore laxative she uses to steam her pores), to the relatively unexciting items she is determinedly specific about (she uses Heavy Duty Scotch Shipping Packing Tape — if it’s not heavy duty, she’ll, in her words, “have a meltdown”), to the useful and singular (like the Renova pink paper towels her brother David brings her back from London), to the decidedly useless but no less specific (like her plaster — not plastic — fake Cornish Hen).

The important thing is that no object in Sedaris’s house carries less significance than the other: each, from her box of small hats (labeled “Small Hats”) to the five real-hair wigs shelved in her bedroom, is a revered piece of her carefully curated, eccentric ecosystem. Below, some 50 of those items.

Accessories

Photo: AmySedaris/Instagram Goody Ribbon Clips I was obsessed with these Goody bows when I was little. Now I find them on eBay. $18 at eBay Buy

Photo: The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon/YouTube Made-to-Fit Wig This wig was made for me at the University of North Carolina School of the Arts. It’s all real hair. at University of North Carolina School of the Arts Buy

Adam Selman Printed Ribbed Cotton-Blend Socks $11 (was $35, now 69% off) I’m best friends with Adam Selman, and he makes these tube socks, which I’m completely obsessed with. The quality is so nice and cushion-y and thin. Plus, the initials of his company is A.S.S., which is printed on the ankle of these. So I’ve been sending them to assholes lately. $11 at Net-A-Porter Buy

Crafting Tools

Photo: SiamHillTribes/Etsy Half-Inch Pom Poms I cannot live without pom-poms. I put them on everything: pillows, lamps. $10 at Etsy Buy

Photo: PartyFavorsPlus/Etsy Plain White Matches I buy a ton of plain white matchbooks so I can decorate them myself. A must-have. $4 for 50 at Etsy Buy

Photo: Creative Growth Coloring Book Creative Growth, an art studio in Oakland for adults with developmental disabilities, put together this coloring book of the artists’ drawings. $15 at Creative Growth Buy

Photo: AmySedaris/Instagram Spangler Dum-Dum Pops I sell lighters wrapped in Dum-Dums lollipop wrappers. After I finish, I take a picture, then throw them out. $11 at Target Buy

Photo: Avery Avery Self-Adhesive Laminating Sheets $10 (was $12, now 17% off) If people come over, I always offer to laminate something of theirs. I say: “give me something from your wallet, let me laminate it for you.” $10 at Amazon Buy $10 at Amazon Buy

Photo: Kid Made Modern Kids’ Paper for Adults My friend Todd Oldham makes the best — and my most favorite — construction paper. $8 at Target Buy

Photo: Talas Jade 403 PVA Adhesive This is the best glue for if you’re decoupaging, and you don’t want it to gum up. I like to think of it as a little hidden secret. From $7 at Talas Buy

Jean Royère $64 (was $90, now 29% off) This is one of my favorite books about decorating. I used it for inspiration when I was working on my TV show. $64 at Amazon Buy $64 at Amazon Buy

Beauty Things

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor Comme Des Garcons Avignon Eau De Toilette I have 13 bottles of Comme des Garçons’ Avignon perfume, just in case they ever stop making it. $95 at Nordstrom Buy

Photo: EVER-SHiFTiNG-PARADiGM / Alamy Stock Photo/Alamy Stock Photo First Aid Cotton Swabs First Aid is one of the only companies making wooden swabs anymore, which is a shame. $5 at Amazon Buy $5 at Amazon Buy

Buly 1803 Superfin Mexican Tuberose Soap Buly 1803 makes the most beautiful soaps. My brother David bought me the perfume version of this Tuberose one. $44 at Mr Porter Buy

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor Swiss Kriss Herbal Laxative Flakes $7 (was $8, now 13% off) I use this herbal laxative to steam my pores; I’ve never found anything better. Some people use it in tea when they’re constipated. $7 at Amazon Buy $7 at Amazon Buy

Epicuren Enzyme Concentrate Vitamin Protein Complex I keep this enzyme spray in every room of my house: bathroom, living room, bedroom, plus two in my office. I just spray it on all the time, whenever I look at it. $31 at Dermstore Buy

Epicuren After Bath Moisturizer in Kukui Coconut My favorite body lotion is also from Epicuren, it’s called After Bath Moisturizer. I like the Kukui Coconut scent. I use it every day, often twice. $40 at Amazon Buy $40 at Amazon Buy

Epsom Salt Fresh Bath Soak I’m obsessed with Epsom salts, obsessed with them. I take Epsom baths all the time. $5 at Target Buy

Bedding

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor Pacific Coast Down Pillow The exact ones they used to use at the haunted Heathman Hotel. $95 at Amazon Buy $95 at Amazon Buy

Photo: Bates Mill Store Bates Mill Store Snowdrop Bedspread My rabbit, Tina, constantly chews these linen bedspreads up. Which means I buy about four sets a year. $100 at Bates Mill Store Buy

Kitchen Things

Photo: Formaggio Kitchen/gabigago Bonilla a la Vista Snack Potato Chips David hauls a huge drum of these on the plane from London for me. They’re made with olive oil, and they’re the best potato chips I’ve ever had in my life. $70 at Amazon Buy $28 at Formaggio Kitchen Buy

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor Renova Fuchsia Paper Towel 4-pack David also brings me back these Renova paper towels; he finds them at his local Tesco. $16 at Amazon Buy $16 at Amazon Buy

Photo: NoPro Norpro Deluxe Bean Frencher When I want to jazz up a meal, I’ll get out my Norpro hand-crank bean Frencher. $23 at Amazon Buy $23 at Amazon Buy

Home Repair

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor Heavy Duty Metal Wall Brackets I have an abundance of L brackets, so I can put up shelves to hold all my stuff. Straight guys love L brackets. Every time a straight guy comes over he says, “I wish you had some L brackets, so I could help you put up some shelves.” And I say, “well I have an abundance of L brackets!” $23 at Amazon Buy $23 at Amazon Buy

Décor

Photo: Kutimall/Etsy Mini Straw Hat My small box of small hats says small hats on it. I also have two boxes filled with googly eyes: one fancy, one not. $2 at Etsy Buy

Photo: John Derian Company Inc Drowsy Tiger Rug I bought the tiger rug in my bedroom at John Derian. It sits at the foot of my bed. $145 at Collyer’s Mansion Buy

Photo: Autom 100% Pure Beeswax Candles I get my beeswax candles from a church-supply site. Greek Orthodox churches have the most beautiful candles, so I figured a church supply website would be the place to go. I was right. From $89 at Church Supply Warehouse Buy

Cire Trudon Ernesto Classic Candle But I also love Cire Trudone’s Ernesto candle. I’m really serious about lighting candles for people when they come over. And this one burns really nicely. $95 at Forward by Elyse Walker Buy

Photo: Jean-store/Ebay Kylin Express Chair Knit Socks I got these little chair socks in Tokyo. They go on the legs of your furniture. $18 at Amazon Buy $18 at Amazon Buy

Photo: Vintagebarbies/Ebay Doll Wigs I also have a large collection of doll wigs. This one looks like a mole. $11 at eBay Buy

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor Ugly Face Jug Rebecca Morgan did a lot of pieces for my TV show, and she made this little ugly jug, which sits on my bookshelf. at Asya Geisberg Gallery Buy

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor L’Artisan Parfumeur Amber Sachet I keep these fancy amber fragments in a seashell in my bathroom. $55 at L'Artisan Parfumeur Buy

World of Interiors World of Interiors is my favorite magazine, it’s the only one I get in the mail. I look at it, then I hand it off to my friend Paul Dinello. $95 for 12 at Amazon Buy $95 for 12 at Amazon Buy

Santa Maria Novella Cardboard Gift Box I’m obsessed with empty boxes, it’s the one thing I want to change about myself but cannot. When we were doing Sex and the City, I used to ask Sarah Jessica for her boxes, because she had amazing ones from Manolo and Hermès. Santa Maria Novella boxes are really good. They’re the perfect size for, say, a dead mouse. $4 at eBay Buy

Stuff for Tina the Rabbit

Photo: B&G Foods Green Giant Sweet Fixin’s Julienned Carrots These are a big extravagance for Tina. I call them her french fries. She rarely gets them, because it’s too much sugar. She also occasionally eats a tiny raisin, and in the morning, she gets half a banana slice. She’s a lucky rabbit. $4 at Instacart Buy

Photo: Howcast; Howcast/Youtube Sweet Meadow Timothy Hay I order nine pounds of hay from a farm near Boston called Sweet Meadow. $7 at Cheshire Horse Buy

Photo: Drollery Press House Rabbit Handbook House Rabbit Handbook is the only good book on rabbit care. I have several copies. $9 at Amazon Buy $9 at Amazon Buy

Gifts

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor Il Bisonte Leather Snap and Flap Wallet Il Bisonte wallets are my go-to gift for straight and gay guys. $250 at Bergdorf Goodman Buy

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor Miniature Crutches by David Krupick I always give these mini-crutches to friends who are in plays so I can say, “You gave a crippling performance.” $24 at S P Miniatures Buy

Photo: Astor Wines & Spirits Monkey 47 Schwarzwald Dry Gin It’s better than any other gin I’ve ever tried, and it comes in a nice small bottle with a little monkey on it. $47 at Astor Wines & Spirits Buy

Photo: Fritz Heisterkamp/Copyright:KRYOLAN GmbH-Fritz Heisterkamp Kryolan Tear Stick If you put this Kryolan under your eye, you automatically cry. I gift it to teens, because it’s just a blast to use. $4 at Kryolan Buy

Fakes

Photo: Bellatopperandmore/Etsy Pastel Pink Fake Cake I used to make fake cakes. Now I usually buy them. $20 at Etsy Buy

Photo: Display Fake Foods Roasted Cornish Hen My kitchen is rife with fake meats: Cornish hens, rib roasts. $29 at Display Fake Foods Buy

Photo: Courtesy of Vendor Sapporo Tumbler I bought this frosty fake beer in the restaurant district in Tokyo. I got four, but I really should have gotten more. $34 at Maiduru Buy

description: Amy Sedaris, actress, comedian, and writer, takes her things very seriously. Everything, from her box of small hats to the five real-hair wigs, is a revered piece of her carefully-curated, eccentric ecosystem. Here are 50 of her favorite things.
